div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2149 Sicily, 1877 Burial: c. 310 B.C.? (K) Contents: 65 AR Pegasi Corinth: 32 (to Per. V with Ε, Ν, ΑΛ, Α, ΑΡ, ΔΙ) Ambracia: 3 (as Ravel 6, -/P78, 163) Anactorium: 2 (leaf, temple-key) Argos: 1 (obv. dog, ΑΡ) Corcyra: 1 (ΚΟΡ) Dyrrhachium: 6 Leucas: 19 (incl. caduceus [11]; wreath [2]; pentagram, cock, grapes, hippocamp, amphora) Thyrrheium: 1 (ear-ring) Disposition: Palermo Tusa Cutroni, AIIN 1956, p. 207, no. VI; † 1958-9, pp. 167-77
